title: Bug 38131ajc needs -d option while correctly compiling classes from subpackage
OB: When compiling a class in a subpackage using ajc, a duplicate "subpackage" directory is created under the existing subpackage directory.
EB: But it will be nice to have the same behavior as javac.
SR:
To reproduce:

1. Create a class in a subpackage.
2. Use the ajc command to compile the class.
3. Observe the creation of a duplicate "subpackage" directory under the existing subpackage directory.
